p: Particularly in LMICs, crowding of large families in small houses, low levels of sanitation and personal hygiene, indoor and outdoor smoke pollution, malnutrition, vitamin and mineral deficiencies, and a high frequency of RTIs may have detrimental effects on the integrity of the respiratory mucosa, respiratory function, and the immune status, making the patient more prone to repeated and more severe viral infection and to secondary bacterial infection. Old and very young age, including prematurity, are additional risk factors for a more severe course.
